message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.CC 

This paper deals with private information retrieval (PIR) from databases (DBs) with storage constraints, which involves information theory (cs.IT), data structures (cs.DS), cryptography (cs.CR), databases (cs.DB), and complexity theory (cs.CC). The paper proposes capacity-achieving schemes for PIR from uncoded DBs with both homogeneous and heterogeneous storage constraints, which are relevant to all of these sub-categories.
